definition: to make a move (in martial arts or figuratively)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess

sentences.english: Not a moment passed in any day that he did not have to think of the taste of Banzo's sword.
sentences.chinese: 沒有哪一天不去思考師父的出招。

sentences.english: Don't give your colleage a reason to feel attacked.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓人覺得你出招了。

sentences.english: No longer does nage simply accept whatever the uke dishes out.
sentences.chinese: 取方不再只是接受受方的出招。

definition: to counter every move/to be full of tricks
move (in chess, on stage, in martial arts)/gambit/trick/scheme/movement/same as 著數|着数[zhao1 shu4]
to resist/to ward off/to hold one's own/to receive guests
to face the enemy/to meet an attack
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
Chinese boxing/fist and feet/punching and kicking
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
